definitions: having the power, skill, means, or opportunity to do something
having considerable skill, proficiency, or intelligence

exampleSentences.english: he was able to read Greek at the age of eight
they would never be able to afford such a big house
exampleSentences.turkish: bu kadar büyük bir evi asla karşılayamazlar.

exampleSentences.english: the dancers were technically very able

definitions: possession of the means or skill to do something
talent, skill, or proficiency in a particular area

exampleSentences.english: the manager had lost his ability to motivate the players
exampleSentences.turkish: teknik direktör oyuncuları motive etme yeteneğini kaybetmişti
